newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - April 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - April 1.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - Formosa Chairman Wang Yung-ching says Formosa has not yet financed any investment in China power plant.
Fang Yuan township head Chen Chu-tsan detained on charges of corruption.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Formosa to drop China power plant project if government disapproves.
Central bank governor Sheu Yuan-dong to open inquiry to check flow of Taiwan funds into mainland China.
LIBERTY TIMES - Wang Yung-ching to abandon China power plant.
Wu Shih-wen to become navy commander-in-chief.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Formosa chairman Wang Yung-Ching and Economic Minister Wang Chih-kang meet, reach agreement on Formosa's investment in Fujian power station.
Central bank officials admit it difficult to chase bid-capital businesses' fund flows.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Wall Street plunges.
Foreign stocks can be traded in Taiwan in July.
